name: git-extra-commands
description: This extension provies vscode commands for starting an interactive rebase and performing a hard reset to the current state of origin.

commands.title: Extra Git Commands: Start an interactive rebase
Extra Git Commands: Hard reset to the current state of origin

enumDescriptions: This uses a normal process instead of the integrated terminal for the interactive rebase. It is recommended to set core.editor to a graphical editor (e.g. vscode) in your git config, because a normal process cannot execute terminal editors like vim or nano

Experimental: Switches the core.editor git setting to vscode only for the duration of the rebase. This is intended to be used with the gitlens extension and the interactive rebase editor enabled, and when you want to continue using your normal editor outside from vscode.
Uses vscodes terminal to start the rebase. The terminal should be shown if it is not present.

git-extra-commands.hardReset.hideWarning.description: Whether the extension should show a warning and ask the user for permission before performing a hard reset.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
